content:
Diagnosis:	Merkel cell carcinoma right forearm

Management:	12 Apr 2024 Wide local excision with 2cm margins and sentinel lymph node biopsy

Histology:	pT1 (8mm) Merkel cell carcinoma, clear margins >1cm. 0/2 sentinel nodes negative.
	MCPyV positive, PD-L1 expression present but percentage not quantifiable

Current Situation:	Post-operative review

I reviewed [redacted name] today following his recent surgery for a Merkel cell carcinoma of the right forearm. The surgical site is healing well with no evidence of wound complications. The sentinel node biopsy sites in the right axilla are also healing appropriately.

He remains well with no new symptoms. Performance status is 0. On examination today, there is no evidence of local recurrence or regional lymphadenopathy. The surgical site shows expected post-operative changes.

Given the completely excised T1 tumor with negative sentinel nodes, we have discussed the management options. While adjuvant radiotherapy could be considered, given the small size, clear margins, and negative nodes, we have agreed to proceed with close surveillance.

The plan is for 3-monthly reviews for the first year with careful examination of the surgical site and regional nodes. I have arranged baseline CT chest/abdomen/pelvis for next week to complete staging. We will see him again with the scan results in 2 weeks' time.
